Doing It Right! MS Dhoni Takes Part In Charity Football Match

Doing It Right! MS Dhoni Takes Part In Charity Football Match

MS Dhoni, who is on a hiatus from cricket was spotted playing in a charity football match in Mumbai.

Facebook

The former Indian captain was seen taking to football along with tennis legend Leander Paes and both looked in very good spirits. The pair was also joined by Bollywood star Arjun Kapoor.

The firm which manages Dhoni, Rhiti Sports, posted pictures of the duo along with several others on their official Facebook handle on Monday.

“Captain Cool: MS Dhoni with Indian tennis player Leander Paes in Mumbai for Charity Football Match,” read the post on the social networking site.

Although Dhoni and Paes were seen wearing practice jerseys with “Playing for Humanity” written on them in the pictures, the cause of the charity and the date of the match is unclear.

Dhoni is enjoying his time off and has kept himself busy, he was earlier also seen enjoying a game of billiards. The break has given the wicket-keeper batsman the opportunity to enjoy himself off the pitch.

Facebook

The speculation over his retirement has persisted, but Dhoni is yet to take a call on his career.

He has made himself unavailable for selection until November. He has already missed the West Indies tour, the South Africa T20 series and will also take no part in series against Bangladesh.

After coming back from the World Cup, the 38-year-old spent a chunk of the break time serving in the Territorial Army, where he is an honorary lieutenant colonel.

MS Dhoni seems to to pay no heed to the rumours as he continues have a good time away from cricket.

(With Inputs From PTI)
